item.title: [Help Req] PowerFisher/Cooker Script
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

Hey, Iâ€™m trying to write a PowerFisher for Barbarian Village [and itâ€™ll cookâ€¦ eventually], But a lot of crap keeps messing up on me.

I was wondering if any of the more experienced scripters could point out any errors or anything you could teach me to make this run better.

Heres my source:

[code]{ ###########################################

Barbarian Village

Power Fishing + Cooking

By KyleGut3

Version 1.0

###########################################

|Version History:-------------------------
|*v1.0 - Script Made |
| |
|Requirements:---------------------------|
|*Bait/Feathers in First Item Slot |
|*Pole in Second |
|*Tinderbox in Third |
|*Axe of your choice in Fourth |
| |
|Notes:----------------------------------|
|*Setup Are lines 32-34 |
|*Best if used on Moparscape |

}

program PowerFishCook;
{.include Squig2.txt}

var fishing :integer;

const
fishsymb=16146433; //blue color from fishing symbol
fishspot=15980728; //white part of any fishing spot
maptree=872736; //tree color on map
mstree=1317912; //tree color on the mainscreen

procedure GotoSpot1;
var a1,b1 :Integer;
begin
if(FindColor(a1,b1,fishsymb,600,25,710,140)= true)Then
wait(100);
MouseC(a1 + random(3), b1 + random(3), 1);
wait(100);
Writeln(â€˜Found Symbolâ€™);
if(FindColor(a1,b1,fishsymb,600,25,710,140)= false)Then
begin
Writeln(â€˜Fishing Symbol Not Foundâ€™);
end;
end;

procedure GotoSpot2;
var a1,b1 :Integer;
begin
if(FindColor(a1,b1,fishsymb,600,110,710,140)= true) then
WaitR(100, 10);
MouseC(a1 + random(3), b1 + random(3), 1);
Wait(100);
Writeln(â€˜Found Symbolâ€™);
if(FindColor(a1,b1,fishsymb,600,110,710,140)= false) then
begin
Writeln(â€˜Fishing Symbol Not Foundâ€™);
end;
end;

procedure BeginFishing;
var x,y,spot :Integer;
begin
spot:= 0;
if(FindColorTolerance(x,y,fishspot,265,65,350,240,5)= true)then
begin
Writeln(â€˜Will Start Fishing Hereâ€™);
wait(100);
MouseC(x + random(3), y + random(3), 1);
fishing := 1;
end;
if(FindColorTolerance(x,y,fishspot,265,65,350,240,5)= false)then
begin
Writeln(â€˜Cannot Find Spot, Moving To Other Locationâ€™);
if(spot = 0)then
begin
GotoSpot2;
waitR(8000,2000);
spot:= 1;
end;
if(spot = 1) then
begin
GotoSpot1;
waitR(8000,2000);
spot:= 0;
end;
end;
end;

procedure CheckFishing;
var x1,y1 :integer;
begin
FindObject(â€˜Fishing Spotâ€™,fishspot,0);
wait(100);
GetMousePos(x1,y1);
wait(100);
MouseC(x1,y1,1);
MouseC(x1,y1,1);
end;

procedure GotoTrees;
var x,y :integer;
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,maptree,635,25,350,125)= true)then
begin
fishing := 0;
WaitR(100,100);
MouseC(x + random(3), y + random(3), 1);
end;
end;

procedure TreeChop;
var x,y :integer;
begin
if(FindObject(â€˜Treeâ€™,mstree,0)=true)then
begin
GetMousePos(x,y);
WaitR(100,100);
MouseC(x + random(3),y + random(3),2);
WaitR(50,50);
ClickText(â€˜Chopâ€™,1,1,510,330,true);
end;
end;

procedure LightLogs;
begin

end;

begin
fishing:= 0;
SetupSquig(â€˜WinAmpâ€™);
GotoSpot1;
WaitR(3000, 1000);
BeginFishing;
repeat
WaitR(2000,5000);
CheckFishing;
WaitR(1000,1000);
until(Itemcount=28);
Drop(28,28);
WaitR(100,500);
GotoTrees;
WaitR(2500,1000);
TreeChop;
end.[/code]

Any tips/ help you guys could give me would be awesome! [also some testers would be nice, to make sure its just not only me thats screwing stuff up]

Thanks
